title: Citi Bahrain Appoints Sharad Gupta Corporate Banking Head for Bahrain & Riad Azzi Senior Legal Counsel for Bahrain, Kuwait & Qatar
summary: Manama, Bahrain - Citi Bahrain announced today the appointment of Sharad Gupta as the Corporate Banking Head for Citi in Bahrain and Riad Azzi as Senior Legal Counsel for Bahrain, Kuwait and Qatar.
tag-1: Citi Bahrain Appoints Sharad Gupta Corporate Banking Head for Bahrain & Riad Azzi Senior Legal Counsel for Bahrain, Kuwait & Qatar
tag-2: Manama, Bahrain – Citi Bahrain announced today the appointment of Sharad Gupta as the Corporate Banking Head for Citi in Bahrain and Riad Azzi as Senior Legal Counsel for Bahrain, Kuwait and Qatar.
tag-3: Sharad is a seasoned banker who has spent most of his career with Citi. This is his second stint in Bahrain, having previously worked as a Senior Relationship Manager in Corporate Banking at Standard Chartered Bank between 2004 and 2006. Most recently, Sharad was a Director at the Corporate and Investment Bank for Citi in the UAE, a position he assumed between 2006 and 2013.
tag-4: "I am delighted to be back in Bahrain with a great team of professionals in Citi that began operating in Bahrain more than 40 years ago. I look forward to working with the team to contribute to the franchise's well established business in the Kingdom," said Sharad.
tag-5: Riad Azzi has moved to Bahrain from Citibank in Kuwait, a position he held since June 2011. Before Citi, he was a senior associate with DLA Piper Middle East and prior to that, Riad was a regional legal counsel with BNP Paribas Bahrain. In his new role, he will be the legal counsel for Corporate Banking in Bahrain in addition to Kuwait and Qatar.
tag-6: "The added responsibilities in the Bahrain branch, combined with running Qatar and Kuwait legal operations are greater and more challenging to my career with Citi. I am proud to be part of the team here and look forward to add value to the franchise in the region," commented Riad Azzi.
tag-7: "Bahrain remains an important GCC market which carries much potential for Citi. In 2010, we began expanding our teams in the Kingdom to provide the highest standards of banking services to our clients in Bahrain and the region," said Mazin Manna, Citi's Chief Executive Officer for Citi in Bahrain. "Sharad and Riad's solid banking background, diverse experience and strong exposure in the Middle East will be fully utilized to customize comprehensive financial solutions for our clients."
tag-8: Citi has been in the Arab World for nearly 50 years and views the region as critical to its global franchise. It currently offers full scale corporate and investment banking services in UAE, Bahrain, Qatar, Kuwait, Egypt, Lebanon, Jordan, Tunisia, Morocco and Algeria.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
